  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);

        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<!----></span><br>I use Mac for example(video1)<span class="line"><!---->I use Mac for example(video1)<!----></span><br>1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting => payment method)<span class="line"><!---->1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting =&gt; payment method)<!----></span><br>2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings => payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings =&gt; payment method<!----></span><br>2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<span class="line"><!---->3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<!----></span><br>4. crash occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. crash occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<span class="line"><!---->In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<span class="line"><!---->347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<!----></span><br>348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<span class="line"><!---->348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<!----></span><br>349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<span class="line"><!---->349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<!----></span><br>350<span class="line"><!---->350<!----></span><br>351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<span class="line"><!---->351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<!----></span><br>352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<span class="line"><!---->352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<!----></span><br>353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<span class="line"><!---->353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<!----></span><br>354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<span class="line"><!---->354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<!----></span><br>355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>356        base::BindOnce(&WaitForEvent, &ready_to_start_authentication_),<span class="line"><!---->356        base::BindOnce(&amp;WaitForEvent, &amp;ready_to_start_authentication_),<!----></span><br>357        base::BindOnce(&CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<span class="line"><!---->357        base::BindOnce(&amp;CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<!----></span><br>358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>359  } else {<span class="line"><!---->359  } else {<!----></span><br>360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<span class="line"><!---->360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<!----></span><br>361  }<span class="line"><!---->361  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =>  UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =&gt;  UAF.<!----></span><br>Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<span class="line"><!---->Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<!----></span><br><br>Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<span class="line"><!---->Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<!----></span><br>The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<span class="line"><!---->The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>302   if (card->record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<span class="line"><!---->302   if (card-&gt;record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<!----></span><br>303     accessor->OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<span class="line"><!---->303     accessor-&gt;OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<!----></span><br>304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<span class="line"><!---->304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<!----></span><br>305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<span class="line"><!---->305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<!----></span><br>306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<span class="line"><!---->306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<!----></span><br>307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<span class="line"><!---->307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<!----></span><br>308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()->IsUserOptedIn());<span class="line"><!---->308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()-&gt;IsUserOptedIn());<!----></span><br>309     }<span class="line"><!---->309     }<!----></span><br>310 #endif<span class="line"><!---->310 #endif<!----></span><br>311     return;<span class="line"><!---->311     return;<!----></span><br>312   }<span class="line"><!---->312   }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<span class="line"><!---->The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<!----></a><br><br>==========================<span class="line"><!---->==========================<!----></span><br>Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<span class="line"><!---->Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<!----></span>https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html"><!---->https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<span class="line"><!----> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<!----></span><br><br>1. open patched chromium<span class="line"><!---->1. open patched chromium<!----></span><br>2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =>  payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =&gt;  payment method<!----></span><br>3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <span class="line"><!---->3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<span class="line"><!---->4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<!----></span><br>5. ASAN log shows up<span class="line"><!---->5. ASAN log shows up<!----></span><br><br>PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<span class="line"><!---->PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: <span class="line"><!---->OS Version: <!----></span><br>Flash Version:<span class="line"><!---->Flash Version:<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Autofill Blink&gt;Payments
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Security sheriff here: I'm not going to attempt to reproduce this one due to the various hoops involved. This reporter has a consistent track record of finding UaFs so I'm confident it will turn out to be real!<span class="line"><!---->Security sheriff here: I'm not going to attempt to reproduce this one due to the various hoops involved. This reporter has a consistent track record of finding UaFs so I'm confident it will turn out to be real!<!----></span><br><br>As a browser process UaF this would be critical severity, but given the need for UI interaction I am going to downgrade it to High.<span class="line"><!---->As a browser process UaF this would be critical severity, but given the need for UI interaction I am going to downgrade it to High.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        manasverma: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->manasverma: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days.         I was able to get a few minutes to take a look at this today, so I can share what I have so far.  First off, I've temporarily created a version of merc.ouc@'s test page on our team's test site here, so feel free to give it a look:<span class="line"><!---->I was able to get a few minutes to take a look at this today, so I can share what I have so far.  First off, I've temporarily created a version of merc.ouc@'s test page on our team's test site here, so feel free to give it a look:<!----></span><br>https://1624581353-dot-dump-truck.appspot.com/crbug/test.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://1624581353-dot-dump-truck.appspot.com/crbug/test.html"><!---->https://1624581353-dot-dump-truck.appspot.com/crbug/test.html<!----></a><br>The reproduction instructions are:<span class="line"><!---->The reproduction instructions are:<!----></span><br>1) Have a card in<span class="line"><!---->1) Have a card in<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>pay.google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pay.google.com"><!---->pay.google.com<!----></a><br>2) Have that card enrolled with Touch ID (you can do this by using it a couple times on <span class="line"><!---->2) Have that card enrolled with Touch ID (you can do this by using it a couple times on <!----></span>https://dump-truck.appspot.com/usecase-cc/cc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://dump-truck.appspot.com/usecase-cc/cc.html"><!---->https://dump-truck.appspot.com/usecase-cc/cc.html<!----></a> to get the appropriate prompt and opt-in event)<span class="line"><!----> to get the appropriate prompt and opt-in event)<!----></span><br>3) On the test page, with Touch ID now default, click into the form's first field and select the credit card within 1 second<span class="line"><!---->3) On the test page, with Touch ID now default, click into the form's first field and select the credit card within 1 second<!----></span><br>4) After 1 second, the iframe is destroyed<span class="line"><!---->4) After 1 second, the iframe is destroyed<!----></span><br><br>However, when I try to reproduce the issue myself on Mac, I don't get a crash.  Instead, it seems to correctly immediately abort the Touch ID request and falls back to a CVC auth.  (The CVC auth never completes either, but it also doesn't crash.)  I've attached a video recording of my tests in Chrome Canary M93, but my Chrome Stable M91 exhibits the same behavior.  I suppose that means I have two questions:<span class="line"><!---->However, when I try to reproduce the issue myself on Mac, I don't get a crash.  Instead, it seems to correctly immediately abort the Touch ID request and falls back to a CVC auth.  (The CVC auth never completes either, but it also doesn't crash.)  I've attached a video recording of my tests in Chrome Canary M93, but my Chrome Stable M91 exhibits the same behavior.  I suppose that means I have two questions:<!----></span><br><br>1) Is there anything wrong with my setup steps such that my browser isn't crashing?  The opening post mentioned "release Chrome" but does that refer to a release version of a local build and Chrome Canary is insufficient?<span class="line"><!---->1) Is there anything wrong with my setup steps such that my browser isn't crashing?  The opening post mentioned "release Chrome" but does that refer to a release version of a local build and Chrome Canary is insufficient?<!----></span><br><br>2) Cancelling a posted task isn't something I'm familiar with; does anyone have a good contact suggestion for who I should talk to?  Is it sufficient to find a way to cancel the task in CreditCardAccessManager's destructor, or is that not an option?<span class="line"><!---->2) Cancelling a posted task isn't something I'm familiar with; does anyone have a good contact suggestion for who I should talk to?  Is it sufficient to find a way to cancel the task in CreditCardAccessManager's destructor, or is that not an option?<!----></span><br><br>Thanks!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks!<!----></span><br>Jared<span class="line"><!---->Jared<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I have uploaded a patch here: <span class="line"><!---->I have uploaded a patch here: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3001123<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3001123"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3001123<!----></a><br><br>Turned out to be much more complex than expected, because ready_to_start_authentication_ could be used after the deallocation and I did not find a way to cancel the task in a trustworthy way.<span class="line"><!---->Turned out to be much more complex than expected, because ready_to_start_authentication_ could be used after the deallocation and I did not find a way to cancel the task in a trustworthy way.<!----></span><br><br>Manas and Jared, I hope that you have a working setup to test the biometric reauth. I learned that I need to take a gazillion hoops to build a binary that get access to the biometric sensors on a mac.<!----></span><br><br>I was able to reproduce the crash with "patch" from the initial commend and the crash does not happen anymore.<span class="line"><!---->I was able to reproduce the crash with "patch" from the initial commend and the crash does not happen anymore.<!----></span><br><br>I am pretty confident that the crash is fixed. But I would like to seek validation that I have not broken anything as I am not super familiar with the CreditCardAccessManager.<span class="line"><!---->I am pretty confident that the crash is fixed. But I would like to seek validation that I have not broken anything as I am not super familiar with the CreditCardAccessManager.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");

 }
 }
 });

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically

  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);

          display: block;

          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;

          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }

          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

      z-index: 8675309; /* Jenny */
    }
    .__crdxFeedbackButton:hover,
    .__crdxFeedbackButton:hover::after {
      opacity: .75;
    }
    .__crdxFeedbackButton::after {
      color: #707070;
      content: "Feedback";
      font-size: 12px;
      left: 50%;
      opacity: 0;
      position: absolute;
      text-decoration: none;
      top: 28px;
      transform: translateX(-50%);
      transition: opacity .4s;
      -webkit-transform: translateX(-50%);
    }

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;

  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);

  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<!----></span><br>I use Mac for example(video1)<span class="line"><!---->I use Mac for example(video1)<!----></span><br>1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting => payment method)<span class="line"><!---->1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting =&gt; payment method)<!----></span><br>2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings => payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings =&gt; payment method<!----></span><br>2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<span class="line"><!---->3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<!----></span><br>4. crash occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. crash occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<span class="line"><!---->In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<span class="line"><!---->347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<!----></span><br>348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<span class="line"><!---->348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<!----></span><br>349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<span class="line"><!---->349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<!----></span><br>350<span class="line"><!---->350<!----></span><br>351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<span class="line"><!---->351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<!----></span><br>352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<span class="line"><!---->352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<!----></span><br>353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<span class="line"><!---->353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<!----></span><br>354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<span class="line"><!---->354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<!----></span><br>355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>356        base::BindOnce(&WaitForEvent, &ready_to_start_authentication_),<span class="line"><!---->356        base::BindOnce(&amp;WaitForEvent, &amp;ready_to_start_authentication_),<!----></span><br>357        base::BindOnce(&CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<span class="line"><!---->357        base::BindOnce(&amp;CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<!----></span><br>358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>359  } else {<span class="line"><!---->359  } else {<!----></span><br>360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<span class="line"><!---->360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<!----></span><br>361  }<span class="line"><!---->361  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =>  UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =&gt;  UAF.<!----></span><br>Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<span class="line"><!---->Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<!----></span><br><br>Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<span class="line"><!---->Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<!----></span><br>The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<span class="line"><!---->The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>302   if (card->record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<span class="line"><!---->302   if (card-&gt;record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<!----></span><br>303     accessor->OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<span class="line"><!---->303     accessor-&gt;OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<!----></span><br>304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<span class="line"><!---->304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<!----></span><br>305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<span class="line"><!---->305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<!----></span><br>306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<span class="line"><!---->306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<!----></span><br>307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<span class="line"><!---->307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<!----></span><br>308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()->IsUserOptedIn());<span class="line"><!---->308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()-&gt;IsUserOptedIn());<!----></span><br>309     }<span class="line"><!---->309     }<!----></span><br>310 #endif<span class="line"><!---->310 #endif<!----></span><br>311     return;<span class="line"><!---->311     return;<!----></span><br>312   }<span class="line"><!---->312   }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<span class="line"><!---->The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<!----></a><br><br>==========================<span class="line"><!---->==========================<!----></span><br>Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<span class="line"><!---->Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<!----></span>https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html"><!---->https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<span class="line"><!----> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<!----></span><br><br>1. open patched chromium<span class="line"><!---->1. open patched chromium<!----></span><br>2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =>  payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =&gt;  payment method<!----></span><br>3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <span class="line"><!---->3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<span class="line"><!---->4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<!----></span><br>5. ASAN log shows up<span class="line"><!---->5. ASAN log shows up<!----></span><br><br>PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<span class="line"><!---->PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: <span class="line"><!---->OS Version: <!----></span><br>Flash Version:<span class="line"><!---->Flash Version:<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Autofill Blink&gt;Payments
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Security sheriff here: I'm not going to attempt to reproduce this one due to the various hoops involved. This reporter has a consistent track record of finding UaFs so I'm confident it will turn out to be real!<span class="line"><!---->Security sheriff here: I'm not going to attempt to reproduce this one due to the various hoops involved. This reporter has a consistent track record of finding UaFs so I'm confident it will turn out to be real!<!----></span><br><br>As a browser process UaF this would be critical severity, but given the need for UI interaction I am going to downgrade it to High.<span class="line"><!---->As a browser process UaF this would be critical severity, but given the need for UI interaction I am going to downgrade it to High.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        manasverma: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->manasverma: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days.         I was able to get a few minutes to take a look at this today, so I can share what I have so far.  First off, I've temporarily created a version of merc.ouc@'s test page on our team's test site here, so feel free to give it a look:<span class="line"><!---->I was able to get a few minutes to take a look at this today, so I can share what I have so far.  First off, I've temporarily created a version of merc.ouc@'s test page on our team's test site here, so feel free to give it a look:<!----></span><br>https://1624581353-dot-dump-truck.appspot.com/crbug/test.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://1624581353-dot-dump-truck.appspot.com/crbug/test.html"><!---->https://1624581353-dot-dump-truck.appspot.com/crbug/test.html<!----></a><br>The reproduction instructions are:<span class="line"><!---->The reproduction instructions are:<!----></span><br>1) Have a card in<span class="line"><!---->1) Have a card in<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>pay.google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pay.google.com"><!---->pay.google.com<!----></a><br>2) Have that card enrolled with Touch ID (you can do this by using it a couple times on <span class="line"><!---->2) Have that card enrolled with Touch ID (you can do this by using it a couple times on <!----></span>https://dump-truck.appspot.com/usecase-cc/cc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://dump-truck.appspot.com/usecase-cc/cc.html"><!---->https://dump-truck.appspot.com/usecase-cc/cc.html<!----></a> to get the appropriate prompt and opt-in event)<span class="line"><!----> to get the appropriate prompt and opt-in event)<!----></span><br>3) On the test page, with Touch ID now default, click into the form's first field and select the credit card within 1 second<span class="line"><!---->3) On the test page, with Touch ID now default, click into the form's first field and select the credit card within 1 second<!----></span><br>4) After 1 second, the iframe is destroyed<span class="line"><!---->4) After 1 second, the iframe is destroyed<!----></span><br><br>However, when I try to reproduce the issue myself on Mac, I don't get a crash.  Instead, it seems to correctly immediately abort the Touch ID request and falls back to a CVC auth.  (The CVC auth never completes either, but it also doesn't crash.)  I've attached a video recording of my tests in Chrome Canary M93, but my Chrome Stable M91 exhibits the same behavior.  I suppose that means I have two questions:<span class="line"><!---->However, when I try to reproduce the issue myself on Mac, I don't get a crash.  Instead, it seems to correctly immediately abort the Touch ID request and falls back to a CVC auth.  (The CVC auth never completes either, but it also doesn't crash.)  I've attached a video recording of my tests in Chrome Canary M93, but my Chrome Stable M91 exhibits the same behavior.  I suppose that means I have two questions:<!----></span><br><br>1) Is there anything wrong with my setup steps such that my browser isn't crashing?  The opening post mentioned "release Chrome" but does that refer to a release version of a local build and Chrome Canary is insufficient?<span class="line"><!---->1) Is there anything wrong with my setup steps such that my browser isn't crashing?  The opening post mentioned "release Chrome" but does that refer to a release version of a local build and Chrome Canary is insufficient?<!----></span><br><br>2) Cancelling a posted task isn't something I'm familiar with; does anyone have a good contact suggestion for who I should talk to?  Is it sufficient to find a way to cancel the task in CreditCardAccessManager's destructor, or is that not an option?<span class="line"><!---->2) Cancelling a posted task isn't something I'm familiar with; does anyone have a good contact suggestion for who I should talk to?  Is it sufficient to find a way to cancel the task in CreditCardAccessManager's destructor, or is that not an option?<!----></span><br><br>Thanks!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks!<!----></span><br>Jared<span class="line"><!---->Jared<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I have uploaded a patch here: <span class="line"><!---->I have uploaded a patch here: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3001123<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3001123"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3001123<!----></a><br><br>Turned out to be much more complex than expected, because ready_to_start_authentication_ could be used after the deallocation and I did not find a way to cancel the task in a trustworthy way.<span class="line"><!---->Turned out to be much more complex than expected, because ready_to_start_authentication_ could be used after the deallocation and I did not find a way to cancel the task in a trustworthy way.<!----></span><br><br>Manas and Jared, I hope that you have a working setup to test the biometric reauth. I learned that I need to take a gazillion hoops to build a binary that get access to the biometric sensors on a mac.<!----></span><br><br>I was able to reproduce the crash with "patch" from the initial commend and the crash does not happen anymore.<span class="line"><!---->I was able to reproduce the crash with "patch" from the initial commend and the crash does not happen anymore.<!----></span><br><br>I am pretty confident that the crash is fixed. But I would like to seek validation that I have not broken anything as I am not super familiar with the CreditCardAccessManager.<span class="line"><!---->I am pretty confident that the crash is fixed. But I would like to seek validation that I have not broken anything as I am not super familiar with the CreditCardAccessManager.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.
