        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

            Issue 1214234: Security: Heap-use-after-free in CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<!----></span><br>I use Mac for example(video1)<span class="line"><!---->I use Mac for example(video1)<!----></span><br>1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting => payment method)<span class="line"><!---->1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting =&gt; payment method)<!----></span><br>2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings => payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings =&gt; payment method<!----></span><br>2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<span class="line"><!---->3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<!----></span><br>4. crash occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. crash occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<span class="line"><!---->In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<span class="line"><!---->347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<!----></span><br>348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<span class="line"><!---->348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<!----></span><br>349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<span class="line"><!---->349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<!----></span><br>350<span class="line"><!---->350<!----></span><br>351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<span class="line"><!---->351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<!----></span><br>352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<span class="line"><!---->352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<!----></span><br>353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<span class="line"><!---->353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<!----></span><br>354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<span class="line"><!---->354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<!----></span><br>355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>356        base::BindOnce(&WaitForEvent, &ready_to_start_authentication_),<span class="line"><!---->356        base::BindOnce(&amp;WaitForEvent, &amp;ready_to_start_authentication_),<!----></span><br>357        base::BindOnce(&CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<span class="line"><!---->357        base::BindOnce(&amp;CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<!----></span><br>358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>359  } else {<span class="line"><!---->359  } else {<!----></span><br>360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<span class="line"><!---->360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<!----></span><br>361  }<span class="line"><!---->361  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =>  UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =&gt;  UAF.<!----></span><br>Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<span class="line"><!---->Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<!----></span><br><br>Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<span class="line"><!---->Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<!----></span><br>The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<span class="line"><!---->The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>302   if (card->record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<span class="line"><!---->302   if (card-&gt;record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<!----></span><br>303     accessor->OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<span class="line"><!---->303     accessor-&gt;OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<!----></span><br>304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<span class="line"><!---->304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<!----></span><br>305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<span class="line"><!---->305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<!----></span><br>306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<span class="line"><!---->306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<!----></span><br>307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<span class="line"><!---->307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<!----></span><br>308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()->IsUserOptedIn());<span class="line"><!---->308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()-&gt;IsUserOptedIn());<!----></span><br>309     }<span class="line"><!---->309     }<!----></span><br>310 #endif<span class="line"><!---->310 #endif<!----></span><br>311     return;<span class="line"><!---->311     return;<!----></span><br>312   }<span class="line"><!---->312   }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<span class="line"><!---->The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<!----></a><br><br>==========================<span class="line"><!---->==========================<!----></span><br>Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<span class="line"><!---->Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<!----></span>https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html"><!---->https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<span class="line"><!----> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<!----></span><br><br>1. open patched chromium<span class="line"><!---->1. open patched chromium<!----></span><br>2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =>  payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =&gt;  payment method<!----></span><br>3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <span class="line"><!---->3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<span class="line"><!---->4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<!----></span><br>5. ASAN log shows up<span class="line"><!---->5. ASAN log shows up<!----></span><br><br>PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<span class="line"><!---->PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: <span class="line"><!---->OS Version: <!----></span><br>Flash Version:<span class="line"><!---->Flash Version:<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Instead, it seems to correctly immediately abort the Touch ID request and falls back to a CVC auth.  (The CVC auth never completes either, but it also doesn't crash.)  I've attached a video recording of my tests in Chrome Canary M93, but my Chrome Stable M91 exhibits the same behavior.         I successfully tested biometric auth in Mac Canary 93.0.4563.0 (before the fix) and 93.0.4568.0 (after the fix).  I'm asking my team to test on Clank as well.<span class="line"><!---->I successfully tested biometric auth in Mac Canary 93.0.4563.0 (before the fix) and 93.0.4568.0 (after the fix).  I'm asking my team to test on Clank as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      </button>

         * is disabled for this component.

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {

          overflow-y: auto;

          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

        }

            flex-direction: column;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {

          }
          .metadata-container {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1214234: Security: Heap-use-after-free in CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<!----></span><br>I use Mac for example(video1)<span class="line"><!---->I use Mac for example(video1)<!----></span><br>1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting => payment method)<span class="line"><!---->1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting =&gt; payment method)<!----></span><br>2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings => payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings =&gt; payment method<!----></span><br>2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<span class="line"><!---->3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<!----></span><br>4. crash occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. crash occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<span class="line"><!---->In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<span class="line"><!---->347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<!----></span><br>348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<span class="line"><!---->348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<!----></span><br>349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<span class="line"><!---->349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<!----></span><br>350<span class="line"><!---->350<!----></span><br>351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<span class="line"><!---->351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<!----></span><br>352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<span class="line"><!---->352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<!----></span><br>353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<span class="line"><!---->353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<!----></span><br>354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<span class="line"><!---->354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<!----></span><br>355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>356        base::BindOnce(&WaitForEvent, &ready_to_start_authentication_),<span class="line"><!---->356        base::BindOnce(&amp;WaitForEvent, &amp;ready_to_start_authentication_),<!----></span><br>357        base::BindOnce(&CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<span class="line"><!---->357        base::BindOnce(&amp;CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<!----></span><br>358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>359  } else {<span class="line"><!---->359  } else {<!----></span><br>360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<span class="line"><!---->360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<!----></span><br>361  }<span class="line"><!---->361  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =>  UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =&gt;  UAF.<!----></span><br>Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<span class="line"><!---->Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<!----></span><br><br>Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<span class="line"><!---->Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<!----></span><br>The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<span class="line"><!---->The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>302   if (card->record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<span class="line"><!---->302   if (card-&gt;record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<!----></span><br>303     accessor->OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<span class="line"><!---->303     accessor-&gt;OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<!----></span><br>304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<span class="line"><!---->304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<!----></span><br>305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<span class="line"><!---->305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<!----></span><br>306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<span class="line"><!---->306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<!----></span><br>307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<span class="line"><!---->307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<!----></span><br>308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()->IsUserOptedIn());<span class="line"><!---->308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()-&gt;IsUserOptedIn());<!----></span><br>309     }<span class="line"><!---->309     }<!----></span><br>310 #endif<span class="line"><!---->310 #endif<!----></span><br>311     return;<span class="line"><!---->311     return;<!----></span><br>312   }<span class="line"><!---->312   }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<span class="line"><!---->The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<!----></a><br><br>==========================<span class="line"><!---->==========================<!----></span><br>Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<span class="line"><!---->Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<!----></span>https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html"><!---->https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<span class="line"><!----> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<!----></span><br><br>1. open patched chromium<span class="line"><!---->1. open patched chromium<!----></span><br>2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =>  payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =&gt;  payment method<!----></span><br>3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <span class="line"><!---->3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<span class="line"><!---->4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<!----></span><br>5. ASAN log shows up<span class="line"><!---->5. ASAN log shows up<!----></span><br><br>PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<span class="line"><!---->PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: <span class="line"><!---->OS Version: <!----></span><br>Flash Version:<span class="line"><!---->Flash Version:<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Instead, it seems to correctly immediately abort the Touch ID request and falls back to a CVC auth.  (The CVC auth never completes either, but it also doesn't crash.)  I've attached a video recording of my tests in Chrome Canary M93, but my Chrome Stable M91 exhibits the same behavior.         I successfully tested biometric auth in Mac Canary 93.0.4563.0 (before the fix) and 93.0.4568.0 (after the fix).  I'm asking my team to test on Clank as well.<span class="line"><!---->I successfully tested biometric auth in Mac Canary 93.0.4563.0 (before the fix) and 93.0.4568.0 (after the fix).  I'm asking my team to test on Clank as well.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<!----></span><br>I use Mac for example(video1)<span class="line"><!---->I use Mac for example(video1)<!----></span><br>1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting => payment method)<span class="line"><!---->1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting =&gt; payment method)<!----></span><br>2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings => payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings =&gt; payment method<!----></span><br>2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<span class="line"><!---->3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<!----></span><br>4. crash occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. crash occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<span class="line"><!---->In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<span class="line"><!---->347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<!----></span><br>348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<span class="line"><!---->348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<!----></span><br>349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<span class="line"><!---->349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<!----></span><br>350<span class="line"><!---->350<!----></span><br>351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<span class="line"><!---->351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<!----></span><br>352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<span class="line"><!---->352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<!----></span><br>353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<span class="line"><!---->353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<!----></span><br>354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<span class="line"><!---->354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<!----></span><br>355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>356        base::BindOnce(&WaitForEvent, &ready_to_start_authentication_),<span class="line"><!---->356        base::BindOnce(&amp;WaitForEvent, &amp;ready_to_start_authentication_),<!----></span><br>357        base::BindOnce(&CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<span class="line"><!---->357        base::BindOnce(&amp;CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<!----></span><br>358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>359  } else {<span class="line"><!---->359  } else {<!----></span><br>360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<span class="line"><!---->360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<!----></span><br>361  }<span class="line"><!---->361  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =>  UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =&gt;  UAF.<!----></span><br>Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<span class="line"><!---->Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<!----></span><br><br>Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<span class="line"><!---->Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<!----></span><br>The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<span class="line"><!---->The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>302   if (card->record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<span class="line"><!---->302   if (card-&gt;record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<!----></span><br>303     accessor->OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<span class="line"><!---->303     accessor-&gt;OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<!----></span><br>304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<span class="line"><!---->304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<!----></span><br>305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<span class="line"><!---->305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<!----></span><br>306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<span class="line"><!---->306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<!----></span><br>307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<span class="line"><!---->307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<!----></span><br>308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()->IsUserOptedIn());<span class="line"><!---->308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()-&gt;IsUserOptedIn());<!----></span><br>309     }<span class="line"><!---->309     }<!----></span><br>310 #endif<span class="line"><!---->310 #endif<!----></span><br>311     return;<span class="line"><!---->311     return;<!----></span><br>312   }<span class="line"><!---->312   }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<span class="line"><!---->The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<!----></a><br><br>==========================<span class="line"><!---->==========================<!----></span><br>Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<span class="line"><!---->Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<!----></span>https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html"><!---->https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<span class="line"><!----> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<!----></span><br><br>1. open patched chromium<span class="line"><!---->1. open patched chromium<!----></span><br>2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =>  payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =&gt;  payment method<!----></span><br>3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <span class="line"><!---->3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<span class="line"><!---->4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<!----></span><br>5. ASAN log shows up<span class="line"><!---->5. ASAN log shows up<!----></span><br><br>PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<span class="line"><!---->PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before?         Security sheriff here: I'm not going to attempt to reproduce this one due to the various hoops involved. This reporter has a consistent track record of finding UaFs so I'm confident it will turn out to be real!<span class="line"><!---->Security sheriff here: I'm not going to attempt to reproduce this one due to the various hoops involved.         manasverma: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->manasverma: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         I was able to get a few minutes to take a look at this today, so I can share what I have so far.  First off, I've temporarily created a version of merc.ouc@'s test page on our team's test site here, so feel free to give it a look:<span class="line"><!---->I was able to get a few minutes to take a look at this today, so I can share what I have so far. Instead, it seems to correctly immediately abort the Touch ID request and falls back to a CVC auth.  (The CVC auth never completes either, but it also doesn't crash.)  I've attached a video recording of my tests in Chrome Canary M93, but my Chrome Stable M91 exhibits the same behavior.  I suppose that means I have two questions:<span class="line"><!---->However, when I try to reproduce the issue myself on Mac, I don't get a crash. I suppose that means I have two questions:<!----></span><br><br>1) Is there anything wrong with my setup steps such that my browser isn't crashing?  The opening post mentioned "release Chrome" but does that refer to a release version of a local build and Chrome Canary is insufficient?<span class="line"><!---->1) Is there anything wrong with my setup steps such that my browser isn't crashing?         This bug requires manual review: We are only 13 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 13 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1214234: Security: Heap-use-after-free in CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.77 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this bug is available on devices with Touch/Face ID, Windows Hello, Android fingerprint, etc.<!----></span><br>I use Mac for example(video1)<span class="line"><!---->I use Mac for example(video1)<!----></span><br>1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting => payment method)<span class="line"><!---->1. open chrome, login in your google account and add a credit card to you google account(after added you will see the card in your chrome:/setting =&gt; payment method)<!----></span><br>2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings => payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. open Touch ID in chrome://settings =&gt; payment method<!----></span><br>2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <span class="line"><!---->2. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigate to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<span class="line"><!---->3. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(I set the timeout to 1s).<!----></span><br>4. crash occurs<span class="line"><!---->4. crash occurs<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<span class="line"><!---->In function CreditCardAccessManager::FetchCreditCard<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<span class="line"><!---->347  if (should_wait_to_authenticate) {<!----></span><br>348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<span class="line"><!---->348    card_selected_without_unmask_details_timestamp_ =<!----></span><br>349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<span class="line"><!---->349        AutofillTickClock::NowTicks();<!----></span><br>350<span class="line"><!---->350<!----></span><br>351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<span class="line"><!---->351    // Wait for |ready_to_start_authentication_| to be signaled by<!----></span><br>352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<span class="line"><!---->352    // OnDidGetUnmaskDetails() or until timeout before calling Authenticate().<!----></span><br>353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<span class="line"><!---->353    auto task_runner = base::ThreadPool::CreateTaskRunner({base::MayBlock()});<!----></span><br>354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<span class="line"><!---->354    cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_.PostTaskAndReplyWithResult( // [1] if `should_wait_to_authenticate` is true, `cancelable_authenticate_task_tracker_` will posttask and will not cancel it even if `this` is freed.<!----></span><br>355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<span class="line"><!---->355        task_runner.get(), FROM_HERE,<!----></span><br>356        base::BindOnce(&WaitForEvent, &ready_to_start_authentication_),<span class="line"><!---->356        base::BindOnce(&amp;WaitForEvent, &amp;ready_to_start_authentication_),<!----></span><br>357        base::BindOnce(&CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<span class="line"><!---->357        base::BindOnce(&amp;CreditCardAccessManager::Authenticate,<!----></span><br>358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<span class="line"><!---->358                       weak_ptr_factory_.GetWeakPtr()));<!----></span><br>359  } else {<span class="line"><!---->359  } else {<!----></span><br>360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<span class="line"><!---->360    Authenticate(get_unmask_details_returned);<!----></span><br>361  }<span class="line"><!---->361  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =>  UAF.<span class="line"><!---->After we posttask, if we delete `this`(CreditCardAccessManager) by remove the frame, the task will still alive and will called after timeout, which will use freed memory in `this` =&gt;  UAF.<!----></span><br>Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<span class="line"><!---->Because that the release chrome is not built with ASAN so there will be a check fail caused by UAF on MAC.<!----></span><br><br>Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<span class="line"><!---->Note that there are two restrictions at line 302 and line 347<!----></span><br>The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<span class="line"><!---->The first one is that the card you choose must be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD, therefore we need to add a credit card in your google account.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>302   if (card->record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<span class="line"><!---->302   if (card-&gt;record_type() != CreditCard::MASKED_SERVER_CARD) { // the credit card you choose need to be a MASKED_SERVER_CARD<!----></span><br>303     accessor->OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<span class="line"><!---->303     accessor-&gt;OnCreditCardFetched(/*did_succeed=*/true, card);<!----></span><br>304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<span class="line"><!---->304 #if !defined(OS_IOS)<!----></span><br>305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<span class="line"><!---->305     if (should_log_latency_metrics) {<!----></span><br>306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<span class="line"><!---->306       AutofillMetrics::LogUserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection(<!----></span><br>307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<span class="line"><!---->307           AutofillMetrics::PreflightCallEvent::kDidNotChooseMaskedCard,<!----></span><br>308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()->IsUserOptedIn());<span class="line"><!---->308           GetOrCreateFIDOAuthenticator()-&gt;IsUserOptedIn());<!----></span><br>309     }<span class="line"><!---->309     }<!----></span><br>310 #endif<span class="line"><!---->310 #endif<!----></span><br>311     return;<span class="line"><!---->311     return;<!----></span><br>312   }<span class="line"><!---->312   }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<span class="line"><!---->The second one is that this device must support face ID/Touch ID and so on, so we need to turn on Touch ID.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/payments/credit_card_access_manager.cc;drc=09e515fe7ee4d7840b15ac23edb9bbc160686fb3;l=354<!----></a><br><br>==========================<span class="line"><!---->==========================<!----></span><br>Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<span class="line"><!---->Chromium can not login to google account since 2021/01 (<!----></span>https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html"><!---->https://blog.chromium.org/2021/01/limiting-private-api-availability-in.html<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<span class="line"><!----> therefore if you want to get a ASAN log you need to patch the chromium. Apply the patch to chrimium(which will ignore the mentioned two restrictions) and :<!----></span><br><br>1. open patched chromium<span class="line"><!---->1. open patched chromium<!----></span><br>2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =>  payment method<span class="line"><!---->2. add any credit card locally in chrome://setting =&gt;  payment method<!----></span><br>3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <span class="line"><!---->3. start a https server at the folder of poc.html and credit.html and navigator to <!----></span>https://localhost/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://localhost/poc.html"><!---->https://localhost/poc.html<!----></a><br>4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<span class="line"><!---->4. click the first input field, it will show a popup with your credit card info, then click the credit card immediately(timeout 1s).<!----></span><br>5. ASAN log shows up<span class="line"><!---->5. ASAN log shows up<!----></span><br><br>PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<span class="line"><!---->PS: I test chromium-886230 on Linux and use gdb to patch it for convenience, see the video2.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? N/A <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? N/A <!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 91.0.4472.77  Channel: stable<!----></span><br>OS Version: <span class="line"><!---->OS Version: <!----></span><br>Flash Version:<span class="line"><!---->Flash Version:<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I think that the fix is as simple as changing the destructor of CreditCardAccessManager to this:<span class="line"><!---->I think that the fix is as simple as changing the destructor of CreditCardAccessManager to this:<!----></span><br><br>CreditCardAccessManager::~CreditCardAccessManager() {<span class="line"><!---->CreditCardAccessManager::~CreditCardAccessManager() {<!----></span><br>  // Ensure that we are not waiting when the WaitableEvent is destroyed.<span class="line"><!---->  // Ensure that we are not waiting when the WaitableEvent is destroyed.<!----></span><br>  ready_to_start_authentication_.Signal();<span class="line"><!---->  ready_to_start_authentication_.Signal();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately, I cannot get my local MacOS build to offer me TouchID, yet. - Even though the official Dev/Canary builds do.<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately, I cannot get my local MacOS build to offer me TouchID, yet. - Even though the official Dev/Canary builds do.<!----></span><br><br>@merc.ouc could you please give it a try and confirm that this fixes the problem?<span class="line"><!---->@merc.ouc could you please give it a try and confirm that this fixes the problem?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1214234#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
